vscToolbox.searchUrls.description: List of code search engines. Each entry should have 'name' and 'url' properties. Use {query} as placeholder.

name.description: Display name for this search engine

vscToolbox.windbgModuleName.description: Module name to use as prefix for WinDbg breakpoint locations

languageModelTools.name: workspace_symbol
languageModelTools.userDescription: Search for symbols (classes, functions, variables, etc.) in code
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Search for symbols (classes, functions, variables, etc.) across the entire codebase using workspace symbol providers. Supports fuzzy/partial matching. Returns symbol names, kinds (Class, Function, Variable, etc.), file locations, and container names. IMPORTANT: All returned line and character positions are ZERO-BASED. This means if the result shows 'line: 100', that refers to the 101st line in the file (line 100 in zero-based indexing). When passing these positions to other tools like textDocument_references, use them AS-IS without adding or subtracting 1. The optional 'filter' parameter can limit results to specific file paths.

query.description: Symbol text to search for. Supports fuzzy matching (e.g., 'MyClass', 'myFunc', 'Vec' will match 'Vector')

filter.description: Optional array of path patterns to filter results (e.g., ['src/core', 'include/'])

languageModelTools.name: textDocument_references
languageModelTools.userDescription: Find all references to a symbol at a specific location
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Find all references to a symbol at a specific location in a file. Returns all locations where the symbol is used throughout the codebase, including declarations. Use this to understand how a symbol is used, find all call sites of a function, or see where a variable is accessed. Requires exact file URI (file:// format) and zero-based line/character position. The file will be automatically opened if needed.

uri.description: File URI in file:// format (e.g., 'file:///c:/path/to/file.cpp' on Windows or 'file:///path/to/file.cpp' on Unix)

character.description: Zero-based character offset within the line (first character is 0)

position.description: Position of the symbol in the document
